thread.title: Who is your favourite Jay?
thread.title_full: Who is your favourite Blue Jay? | Toronto Star

author: thestar.com
title: Who is your favourite Jay?
text:
The entire Blue Jays team deserves credit for reaching their first post-season in 22 years.
Nevertheless, fans can’t help but root for their favourite player. In a team full of big hitters, it’s not easy to pick just one Jay as your guy.
The Star asked 10 fans who their favourites were and why. Do you agree with their choices?
Share your thoughts View on Poll Daddy Jose Bautista - “It’s got to be him. Absolutely. He hits home runs all the time,” said Mark Bunsco from Vancouver.
Kevin Mahato, Toronto http://www.thestar.com/sports/bluejays/2015/09/03/josh-donaldson-appreciates-mvp-chants-from-blue-jays-fans.html
Josh Donaldson– “He’s our best player on defence. His best moments are those walk-off home runs at the bottom of the ninth. He will be MVP, definitely.”
The Canadian Press
Josh Donaldson.
Edwin Encarnacion - “He’s been very good for a while now. I think he keeps the whole team together,” said Tom from Mississauga.
Chris O'Meara/AP
Ben Revere.
Ben Revere - “He’s come a long way this year. He’s been hitting like a trooper,” said Jim McLeod from Peterborough
Josh Donaldson – “I was excited when he was traded here and he’s really been on fire lately,” said Toronto native Devin Olafson.
Troy Tulowitzki – “He’s had zero errors since he started in Toronto. The guy is an incredible shortstop,” said Jordan Arscott from Toronto.
USA Today Sports
Troy Tulowitzki.
Jose Bautista – “He hits it out the park all the time, and he seems like a good guy,” said Ed Webster from Hamilton
Jose Bautista – “He’s a staple of the team, he’s been around for longer. I’d maybe say Donaldson but it’s his first year, it could be luck. Bautista is always good,” Toronto resident Joe Tavares said.
Ryan Goins – “He’s made a big difference on defence and he’s very underrated compared to the bigger names in the team,” said Todd Smith from Toronto.
Jose Bautista – “He’s been with the team a long while and he’s always been really good, not just this season. He’s very consistent. I remember when the Orioles threw behind him early in the season and he hit a home run on the next play,” said Michael Black from Toronto.
The Toronto Blue Jays are set to for the post-season
